Package Backend

Class JDBC

java.lang.Object
Backend.JDBC
public class JDBC extends Object
Class for handling the back-end part and also the user instance of the Task Manager Application (P3 project). There are 6 tables in the relational database but the application uses only 5 out of them: -userprofessors to validate professors when logging in -similarly userstudents to validate students -subjects is used to check what subjects is the user enrolled to -tasks is for saving and extracting tasks. -taskdistribution is used for distributing newly created tasks to assignee students
Author:
Nevezi-Strango David

      public static boolean searchUser​(String userString, String passwordString) throws SQLException
      Function to search for user in database
      Parameters:
      userString - user's Name
      passwordString - user's Password
      Returns:
      boolean whether user has been found or not
      Throws:

    • createTaskList

      public static void createTaskList() throws SQLException, TaskException
      Function to create the task container for the person instance. RedBlackTree is being used
      Throws:
      SQLException - if an error occurred while accessing the database
      TaskException - if invalid informations where introduced to the tasks

    • searchDistribution

      public static Map<String,​String> searchDistribution​(int taskID) throws SQLException
      Function to search for every Student which had the specified task assigned to. Used for visualizing tasks for Professors
      Parameters:
      taskID - The Task's ID
      Returns:
      A HashMap(String,String), every entry is composed of the student's name and his task's status
      Throws:
      SQLException - if an error occurred while accessing the database

    • saveTasks

      public static void saveTasks​(Task newTask, boolean isNew, boolean isStatusChanged) throws SQLException, TaskException
      Function to save the current task (modified or newly added) into the database
      Parameters:
      newTask - the task that is intended to be modified or newly added
      isNew - whether the newTask parameter is new or has just been modified
      isStatusChanged - if only the status has been changed
      Throws:
      SQLException - if an error occurred while accessing the database
      TaskException - if the task could not have been replaced or inserted

    • deleteTask

      public static void deleteTask​(Task task) throws SQLException, TaskException
      Function to delete the intended task from the database
      Parameters:
      task - The task intended to be deleted
      Throws:
      SQLException - if an error occurred while accessing the database
      TaskException - if the task could not have been deleted
